Age.Description: Continuous variable denoting age in years at the time of data collection (range: 3.5-39 years).

AgeGroup.Description: Specifies age bin of participant at the time of data collection.

Child_Adult.Description: Specifies whether participant was a child or adult at the time of data collection.

DCCS Summary.Description: Dimensional Change Card Sort Summary Score; calculated as outlined in Zelazo, 2006.

FB_Composite.Description: False-Belief Items Composite Score; indicates how manyfalse belief items were answered correctly (out of 6) .

Levels.Pass: Children who answered at least 5 of 6 False Belief items correctly
Levels.Inc: Children who answered 3-4 of 6 False Belief items correctly ("Inconsistent")
Levels.Fail: Children who answered at most 2 of 6 False Belief Items correctly.

KBIT_raw.Description: Raw Score on the KBIT-II Matrices test, which is a measure of non-verbal IQ (Kaufman, 1997)

KBIT_standard.Description: Age-Standardized Score on the KBIT-II Matrices test, which is a measure of non-verbal IQ (Kaufman, 1997)

Scanlog: Coil.Description: Children under age five years used one of two custom 32-channel phased-array head coils made for younger (n=3, M(SD)=3.91(.42) years) or older (n=28, M(SD)=4.07(.42) years) children (Keil et al., 2011); all other participants used the standard Siemens 32-channel head coil.

Levels.5-6yo 32ch: Custom 32ch coil made for young children
Levels.7-8yo 32ch: Custom 32ch coil made for older children

Scanlog: Scanner.Description: At the time of data collection, the Athinoula A. Martinos Imaging Center at MIT had two identical 3T Siemens scanners. Data collection occurred on both scanners.

Scanlog: Slice Gap.Description: Slice gap (i.e., distance between adjacent images) during functional imaging. This varies because different participants were initally recruited for different studies.

Scanlog: Voxel slize.Description: Voxel size during functional imaging. This varies because different participants were initally recruited for different studies.

ToM Booklet-Matched.Description: Continuous variable denoting proportion of ToM Booklet questions answered correctly.

ToM Booklet-Matched-NOFB.Description: Continuous variable denoting proportion of ToM Booklet questions answered correctly, not including false-belief task items (used to generate the composite score and False-Belief grouping).

WPPSI BD raw.Description: Raw score on the WPPSI Block Design subtest, which is a measure of non-verbal IQ (Wechsler, 1989)

WPPSI BD scaled.Description: Age-Standardized Score on the WPPSI Block Design subtest, which is a measure of non-verbal IQ (Wechsler, 1989)

Dimensional Change Card Sort Metadata.Description: Dimensional Change Card Sort (DCCS) is a task that measures the response inhibition component of executive functions, designd for young children (Zelazo, 2006). Children ages 3-5 years old completed this task. The task is comprised of two versions: the standard version (pre-switch task and post-switch task), where children have to sort cards according to one rule (pre-switch), and then according to a new rule (post-switch), and the border version, where children must sort cards according to two rules, depending on whether the card has a border. The shared data is the summary score (0-3), described below.

Scanlog Metadata.Description: Whole-brain structural and functional MRI data were acquired on one of two 3-Tesla Siemens Tim Trio scanners located at the Athinoula A. Martinos Imaging Center at MIT, using one of three 32-channel head coils (see Coil column). As participants were initially recruited for different studies, there are small differences in voxel size and slice gaps across participants (voxel size: 3 mm vs. 3.13 mm isotropic; slice gap: 0, 10% and 20%).

Scanlog: Voxel Size.Description: Whole-brain structural and functional MRI data were acquired on one of two 3-Tesla Siemens Tim Trio scanners located at the Athinoula A. Martinos Imaging Center at MIT, using one of three 32-channel head coils (see Coil column). As participants were initially recruited for different studies, there are small differences in voxel size and slice gaps across participants (voxel size: 3 mm vs. 3.13 mm isotropic; slice gap: 0, 10% and 20%).
